intro: Impatiens abyssinica, commonly known as Abyssinian touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features showy, spurred flowers that are usually pink or white in color. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and upright. Impatiens abyssinica thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
